quiz.text: In which year was the Act of Union between Ireland and Britain passed?

True or false: The Irish Parliament continued to meet after the Union.
True or false: Catholics were immediately granted full political rights after the Union.
True or false: The Act of Union merged Ireland and Britain into a single kingdom.
Which institution was abolished as a result of the Union?
Name one consequence of the Union on Irish governance.
answer: Irish MPs had to sit in Westminster

Which failed uprising inspired later reformers and radicals?

Which two political entities were created by the partition of Ireland?
choices: Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland

quiz.text: True or false: Partition was intended to resolve religious and political conflicts.

True or false: Partition caused tensions that lasted throughout the 20th century.
Who was the first head of government of the Irish Free State?

answer: Northern Ireland remained part of the UK

topic: EUR6. The United States & the World
